summary: When a PHP worker is started with session support enabled via `withEnableSessionWorker(true)`, user-registered activities cannot be found and cause ActivityNotRegisteredError. Only internal session activities are visible to the workflow.
userImpact: Developers cannot execute user-defined activities when using session workers in PHP SDK, blocking the use of sessions for activity execution patterns.
rootCause: Session worker implementation was exposed in configuration before full implementation was complete. User activities are not properly registered alongside internal session activities.
workaround: Use separate task queues for workers instead of session workers, as demonstrated in PHP SDK examples.
keyQuote: it's semi-bug at the moment since we exposed the configuration option for sessions ahead of the actual implementation
